result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricky Randall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Fine of $500.00 including all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges to be paid from bail on deposit, $150.00 to be paid forthwith and balance by 08/12/15 or serve 10 consecutive days in the House of Correction.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricky Randall

records.addlTxt: Per Chief Judge Directive 18-02, the Fine & Cost commitment previously entered in this case shall be converted to a civil judgment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay.   10 days HOC,  consecutive.   Due & owing

Defendant Ricky Randall in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 As to Count TWO: 
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

ON MOTION OF THE STATE, COURT ORDERED COUNT ONE:  DISMISSED AND READ IN AS TO SENTENCING. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 3 days  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served. 

Fine of $500.00 including all mandatory  costs, fees and surchages  to be paid from bail on deposit , $150.00 forthwith and balance  by 8-12-15 or serve 10 consecutive days in the House of Correction.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Received and Filed, State's Requested Jury Instructions.
Received and Filed, State's Witness List.
Received and Filed, State's Motion in Limine.

Defendant Ricky Randall in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 47.  Court down.  Jury trial scheduled for 07-13-2015 at 08:30 am.

Tabbed to Branch 10 in error.
jad
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kevin B.; and B.B. (d.o.b. 09/05/98).

Defendant Ricky Randall in court.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 10  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/13/15 @ 1:30pm
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 05/8/15
